complexity.title: This code is doing a lot at once
complexity.summary: It works right now, but it might be hard to change later. This is common with AI-generated code.
complexity.why: When a function gets big, small changes can accidentally break things. This is very common in AI-generated code ‚Äî you didn't cause this.

action.text: If you ever need to change this, consider breaking it into smaller pieces.

complexity.footer: Totally fine to leave as-is while you're building.

exceptions.title: Errors might disappear silently
exceptions.summary: If something breaks here, you might never see the error. This is fixable, and we'll help you.
exceptions.why: When errors are caught too broadly, bugs can hide instead of telling you what happened. That makes problems much harder to track down later.

action.text: Add logging or re-raise the error so you can see what happened.

exceptions.footer: This is a small change that gives you a lot more peace of mind.

security.title: Sensitive info is hard-coded here
security.summary: If this code is shared, someone else could access your account or service. This is fixable ‚Äî one of the most common beginner mistakes.
security.why: Hard-coded keys can be copied by anyone who sees the code. This is one of the most common beginner mistakes ‚Äî and very fixable.

action.text: Move this value to an environment variable.

security.footer: Once this is moved out, the risk is completely gone.

safety.title: This code controls something real and needs guardrails
safety.summary: This function affects real-world behavior. This is fixable, and we'll help you add the right checks.
safety.why: When code controls physical actions or important systems, it's important to be explicit about safety. This isn't about blame ‚Äî it's about protecting users and yourself.

action.text: Add the safety annotation or checks so unsafe actions can't happen accidentally.

safety.footer: You're catching this early ‚Äî that's a good sign.

global_state.title: This value can change from different places
global_state.summary: This can lead to confusing bugs that are hard to track down. This is common ‚Äî even experienced developers hit this.
global_state.why: When many parts of the code can change the same value, behavior can feel random. These bugs aren't obvious ‚Äî even experienced developers hit them.

action.text: If things start acting strangely, consider passing this value explicitly instead.

global_state.footer: If nothing feels flaky right now, totally fine to leave for now.

dead_code.title: Some code might not be used anymore
dead_code.summary: This code doesn't appear to be called anywhere.
dead_code.why: Unused code can make projects harder to understand, but it's not risky.

action.text: You can tidy this up if you're confident ‚Äî or leave it until later.

dead_code.footer: Leaving unused code won't break anything. No rush at all.
